result.execSummary:
All charges against Tomika N Pridgeon in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tomika N Pridgeon is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tomika N Pridgeon

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Attorney Meera Al-Henaey
The Judge's explanation is outlined on the submitted order.  Competency raised.

Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Al-Henaey appeared by video means. State moves to close case. Defense does not object. Court orders case closed.

Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey in court, defendant Tomika N Pridgeon not in court, in custody. Amanda Kirklewski for James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for return on doctor report. For reasons stated, case adjourned, Branch 2.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from WFU requesting additional time to prepare report
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE.

Defendant Tomika N Pridgeon in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Defendant Tomika N Pridgeon in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tomika N Pridgeon appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Commissioner tolls all applicable time limits.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
